title: Junior Full Stack Developer React/Python
description:
['\n This is a remote position.',
,
, Junior Full Stack Developer React/Python (1 year experience, remote)

, About us:, " Be part of our future! This job posting builds our talent pool for potential future openings. We'll compare your skills and experience against both current and future needs. If there's a match, we'll contact you directly. No guarantee of immediate placement, and we only consider applications from US/Canada residents during the application process.",
,
, 'Hiring Type: Full-Time',
,
, 'Base Salary: $60K-$70K Per Annum.',
,
, 'Candidates ', must be authorized, ' to work in the United States full-time. We are not', able , 'to sponsor applicants for work visas at this time.',
,
, Benefits:

,
  • We offer health benefits and generous PTO packages.
  • Our office is dog friendly, has unlimited snacks & drinks, flexible working hours (get out for the pow day!), and lots of rock climbing & skateboarding.
  • We offer competitive healthcare benefits and a 401k program.
  • we are committed to being a fun, groundbreaking, and inclusive place to work. We strongly encourage engineers from all community and traditionally underrepresented backgrounds to apply

, Responsibilities:

,
  • Architect, design, and implement solutions to complex engineering problems
  • Provide coding expertise in Python (FastAPI and Django), React JS, TypeScript, SQL, NoSQL, and AWS to develop frontend and backend applications.
  • Collaborate with other developers to deliver working software solutions
  • Assist project management with planning, product roadmap planning, and release planning
  • Assist with code reviews and technical reviews

, Qualifications:

,
  • 1 year of professional experience with React JS and Python
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or related
  • Good communication skills, both oral and written

, Nice to Have experience:

,
  • Mobile app development in React Native
  • Thirst For Tech Learning
, '\n']

title: Junior Python Django Developer
description:
['\n This is a remote position.',
,
, Junior Python Django Developer (1 year experience, remote)

, "About us: Be part of our future! This job posting builds our talent pool for potential future openings. We'll compare your skills and experience against both current and future needs. If there's a match, we'll contact you directly. No guarantee of immediate placement, and we only consider applications from US/Canada residents during the application process.",
,
, 'Hiring Type: Full-Time',
,
, 'Base Salary: $57K-$67K Per Annum.',
,
, 'Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States full-time. We are not able to sponsor applicants for work visas at this time.',
,
, 'Benefits:',
,
,
  • We offer health benefits and generous PTO packages.
  • Our office is dog friendly, has unlimited snacks & drinks, flexible working hours (get out for the pow day!), and lots of rock climbing & skateboarding.
  • We offer competitive healthcare benefits and a 401k program.
  • we are committed to being a fun, groundbreaking, and inclusive place to work. We strongly encourage engineers from all community and traditionally underrepresented backgrounds to apply

, About The Job

, 'As a Python Django Developer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining our SaaS product, utilizing Django, Django Rest Framework (DRF), Celery, and MySQL. Your role will involve creating efficient and scalable RESTful services, ensuring high-quality code, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver a superior user experience.',
,
, 'Responsibilities:',
,
,
  • Develop and maintain our SaaS product using Python and Django.
  • Utilize Celery for task scheduling and distributed message passing.
  • Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code, adhering to best practices and coding standards.
  • Optimize application performance, scalability, and reliability.
  • Troubleshoot and debug issues, identifying and implementing solutions.
  • Collaborate with other team members on code reviews and continuous improvement.
  • Stay updated with industry trends and advancements in Django, Python, and related technologies.

, 'Qualifications :',
,
,
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
  • Proven experience as a Python Django Developer, preferably working on SaaS products.
  • Strong proficiency in Python and Django framework.
  • Familiarity with Celery for task scheduling and distributed systems.
  • Proficiency in MySQL or other relational databases.
  • Solid understanding of software development principles and best practices.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot and debug complex issues.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
  • Self-motivated and able to work independently, as well as in a team environment.
  • Strong attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality work.
, '\n']

title: Front-End Developer
description:
['\n',

Job Description:

,

 

,

We are seeking a talented and motivated Front-End Developer with a strong background in Next.js and React to join our team. If you are passionate about creating dynamic, user-centric front-end experiences and have expertise in integrating with RESTful APIs, we'd love to hear from you. Knowledge of Django for backend development is beneficial.

,

 

,

Required Skills & Experience:

,
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • A minimum of 2 years of professional experience in front-end development.
  • Expertise in Next.js and React for front-end development.
  • Solid experience with RESTful APIs, including design, integration, and consumption.
  • Proficient in JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML, CSS, and modern front-end libraries or frameworks.
  • Practical experience with version control systems like Git.
  • Strong understanding of responsive design and cross-browser compatibility.
  • Familiarity with Agile development practices.
,

 

,

Nice to Have:

,
  • Backend experience, particularly with Django.
  • Experience with databases like MongoDB or MySQL.
  • Knowledge of Docker or other containerization technologies.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines.
  • Comfortable using Visual Studio Code or similar development environments.
,

 

,

Key Responsibilities:

,
  • Develop and maintain responsive, high-performance web applications using Next.js and React.
  • Design, implement, and optimize RESTful API integrations to ensure seamless data flow between the client and server.
  • Work closely with UI/UX designers to implement design specifications while ensuring API compatibility.
  • Collaborate with backend developers to ensure front-end components are in sync with server-side logic.
  • Write clean, maintainable, and scalable code with an emphasis on RESTful API interactions.
  • Perform code reviews to maintain high standards of code quality, especially in API usage.
  • Diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve issues related to API integration and front-end performance.
  • Ensure technical feasibility of UI/UX designs with respect to API interactions.
  • Keep up-to-date with emerging trends in RESTful API design and front-end technologies.
,

 

,

How to Apply:

,

Please submit your CV in a PDF file. Additionally, in your application on LinkedIn, please clearly address the following questions:

,

 

,

•            Do you hold a Master’s or bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering or a related field?

,

•            Do you have a minimum of 2 years of work experience in a related field?

,

•            Do you have solid experience with React and Next.js for front-end development?

,

•            Do you have experience in integrating APIs and working with RESTful services?

,

•            Are you legally authorized to work in the United States? This includes individuals on OPT, H-1B visas, or other valid work authorizations.

,

 

,

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, and early submissions are strongly encouraged, as we aim to begin the review and decision-making process as soon as possible.

,
  •  
, '\n']

title: Remote JavaScript Engineer - Software Development
description:
['\n Job Title: Software Engineer (JavaScript) - Remote',
,
, Job Overview

, 'Join our esteemed online trust and safety platform, where we are committed to safeguarding businesses, consumers, and children from deceptive, fraudulent, and non-compliant mobile and Connected TV (CTV) applications. Our cutting-edge software and data solutions are pivotal in addressing critical issues related to digital advertising, privacy, and compliance. With a diverse global team comprised of professionals in fields such as law, data science, engineering, and economics, we strive to maintain a secure online environment.',
,
, 'We are seeking a dedicated and talented Software Engineer with expertise in JavaScript to become a vital part of our innovative team. The successful candidate will possess a comprehensive understanding of web technologies, browser behaviors, DOM manipulation, and video player integration. Familiarity with ad tech is advantageous. This role entails enhancing our measurement capabilities through collaboration with the Open Measurement Software Development Kit (OMSDK) and various JavaScript frameworks.',
,
, Key Responsibilities

,
  • Develop, maintain, and enhance measurement scripts and front-end applications utilizing JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
  • Ensure our OMSDK implementation is current to facilitate improved ad measurement and verification.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate and test new features.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve performance issues in browsers and video players.
  • Partner with the Quality Assurance team to guarantee high-quality deliverables.
  • Stay updated on the latest trends and advancements in web technologies and ad tech.

, Required Skills

,
  • Strong proficiency in JavaScript, demonstrating a solid understanding of its core principles.
  • Experience with front-end frameworks and libraries such as React, Angular, or Vue.js.
  • In-depth knowledge of browser internals, DOM manipulation, and video player integration.
  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs and asynchronous programming.
  • Experience with OMSDK and its application within ad tech solutions.
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities and meticulous attention to detail.
  • Strong communication and teamwork skills.

, Qualifications

,
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • Experience in the ad tech industry is a plus.

, Career Growth Opportunities

, 'Our organization is devoted to fostering an environment of innovation and collaboration, enabling our team members to challenge one another and reach their fullest potential. We are committed to providing pathways for professional development and career advancement.',
,
, Company Culture And Values

, 'We pride ourselves on maintaining a casual, remote work environment that promotes flexibility and creativity. Our team is high-performing and values both success and enjoyment, making it an exciting place to contribute your skills and grow professionally.',
,
, Compensation And Benefits

, 'We offer an extremely competitive compensation package, including:',
,
,
  • Monthly internet reimbursement.
  • Flexible remote working hours.
  • Engaging annual team events.
  • An inclusive team culture emphasizing both achievement and enjoyment.

, 'Employment Type: Full-Time\n ']

title: Software Engineer I
description:
['\n', Pittsburgh Candidate Highly Preferred

, 'Software Engineering I, Productivity Engineering',
,
, About The Team

, "Productivity Engineering team members at TeleTracking are the engineer's engineers. We aim to simplify and amplify the ability for developers to build, deploy, release, and observe their changes in production. By creating software development experiences that provide abstractions around common scenarios, we pave the way for developers to focus on their core business domains.",
,
, "We practice an observability-first and product-minded approach to the services that we develop and operate. To do this, we work backwards from customer value and ease of use, to planning the metrics that will help us differentiate what is working from what isn't before writing a line of code. We validate the effectiveness of our offerings by applying them in production to internally and externally facing services that we own.",
,
, About The Role

, "As a software engineer, you will have autonomy to architect, build and operate components of the delivery and observability platforms that are critical to TeleTracking's needs. You will collaborate with a customer base to explore how they build and deploy changes to uncover the friction that slows them down from deploying to production. With an end-to-end understanding, you will build a developer experience that leverages your findings.",
,
, 'An example of a developer experience that Productivity Engineering team members build is designing an interface, iterating over it until they are satisfied that it is easy to use and implementing its backend services. The backend services are instrumented with metrics that help the team gain insights on usage and improvements.',
,
, 'You will grow, learn, and be challenged by working across many technology stacks that go across build and deployment systems, to cloud infrastructure and microservices, and to security and observability tooling.',
,
, What will you learn?

,
  • Building and operating resilient services that are observable with key metrics and visualize them in Grafana dashboards
  • Leveraging AWS services such as Lambda, EKS, S3, EC2, RDS
  • Designing and writing HTTP and RESTful APIs
  • Designing reusable deployment pipelines in Spinnaker using kustomize and pipeline templates
  • Applying large-scale changes across 100s of source code repositories
  • Helping other engineers to build software better, faster and safely
  • Researching, evaluating, implementing and operating extensions to delivery and observability platforms

, What We Use Today

,
  • Java, Python, Go, JavaScript, react, bash, AWS, Azure, Prometheus, Loki, Grafana, Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, Ansible, Spinnaker, git

, What We Expect

,
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field involving software engineering, or equivalent practical experience
  • 0-2 years of experience with an object oriented or functional programming language

, Bonus Points

,
  • Experience with observability
  • Experience with full cycle development
  • Building developer-facing tools
  • Interest in developing services as well as the underlying infrastructure
  • Experience programming in Java, Python, Go, C++

, Benefits

,
  • Medical/dental/vision plans 100% paid for employees and family members without coverage, which start from day one!
  • Life and AD&D
  • Flexible Spending Accounts: Medical, Dependent Care, and Transportation
  • 401 (k) Retirement Savings
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Military Paid Leave (up to 6 months of base salary while on military leave)
  • Paid Time Off
  • Paid parental leave

, Disclaimer:

, 'The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The term "qualified individual with a disability" means an individual with a disability who, with or without reasonable accommodation, can perform the essential functions of the position.',
,
, 'TeleTracking is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. TeleTracking recruits qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, ethnic or national origin, veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, marital status, or citizenship status.',
,
, 'Recruiting agencies, please do not submit unsolicited referrals for this or any open role. We have a roster of agencies with whom we partner, and we will not pay any fee associated with unsolicited referrals.\n ']

title: Junior Java Developer
description:
['\n',

Responsibilities & Required Skills:

,
  • Experience in developing Object-oriented technologies.
  • Must have experience with web development in Java 8+, Spring, J2EE frameworks and technologies. (At least one project educational or professional project)

company: BoLS Interactive LLC (Bell of Lost Souls)
title: Freelance Web Developer
description:
['\n',

BoLS Interactive is a boutique web-publisher with a passion for games and entertainment. We are looking for a talented web developer to join our team. Our small size and diverse client base requires all team members to have a wide range of skills and wear many hats. This is an hourly contract position with a guaranteed 10 hours per week or more as needed. This position requires the web developer to meet weekly for checkins and work updates but can be done remotely.

,


,

Note: Applicant must be a US citizen and live in the contiguous United States. We are looking for an individual, not a company or group.

,


,

Qualified Candidate will:

,

• Have 2 years minimum experience with WordPress/PHP development.

,

• Have a strong visual portfolio of work with flexibility in your application design style for diverse clients.

,

• Work & communicate in a timely manner when working independently.

,

• Be detail-oriented, professional, and self-directed.

,

• Communicate professionally both verbally and in writing.

,

• Work well independently and as part of a team.

,

• Have excellent oral, written, and visual communication and presentation skills.

,

• Have flexibility and adaptability to a variety of additional tasks and duties as assigned.

,

 

,

Skill Requirements:

,

• Must have experience with WordPress custom theme development

,

• Solid understanding of WordPress architecture and ability to build/customize WordPress plugins/applications. Example of work needed.

,

• Solid understanding of CSS under WordPress using child themes. Example of work needed.

,

• Basic server administrator experience; work within a web server to accomplish tasks in a timely manner (SSH, FTP, Domain setup – DNS, Cloudflare setup).

,

• Able to debug for Javascript and PHP.

,

• Experience  and fluent in implementing responsive web design.

,

• Familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite.

,

• Translate visual designs (PSD comps/ sketches) into completed HTML pages 

,

• Familiarity with Mediawiki/Wikipedia PHP framework.

,

 

,

Pluses:

,

• Understanding of cross-browser compatibility & resolve bugs where required

,

• Knowledge of JQuery and server-side programming.

,

 

,

Qualified candidates please send a cover letter and current resume for consideration to contact@bolsinteractive.com, subject line: WEB DEVELOPER

, '\n']

title: Remote Software Engineer for Stores
description:
['\n', Job Overview

, 'We are looking for an enthusiastic Software Engineer who is passionate about open-source technologies, Linux, and scalable web services. This is a remarkable opportunity to become a vital member of our innovative and expanding team, dedicated to developing significant systems that support large-scale marketplaces. If you thrive in a collaborative environment and wish to engage in impactful projects, this position could be your ideal match.',
,
, 'Our team is responsible for creating and maintaining a collection of backend services that empower major digital marketplaces. These services are predominantly developed using Python, with some components in Golang. As we continue to grow and diversify our services—particularly in the emerging domains of IoT and enterprise solutions—we seek forward-thinking individuals to help us craft the future.',
,
, 'If you are passionate about creating clean APIs, automated testing, and fostering rapid yet dependable development cycles, we invite you to connect with us.',
,
, 'Key Responsibilities',
,
,
  • Collaborate with a globally distributed team in a fully remote setting.
  • Design and develop efficient web service APIs that cater to both CLI and web frontend clients using Python (with optional Golang).
  • Implement new features from specification to production, ensuring consistent operations at scale.
  • Provide constructive feedback on code and technical designs from peers.
  • Engage in brainstorming and collaborative efforts to tackle complex technical challenges.
  • Participate in biannual global travel for internal and external engagements.

, Required Skills

,
  • Demonstrated experience in developing public-facing APIs and web applications using Python.
  • Proficient in backend development and infrastructure technologies.
  • Adept with both relational and non-relational database systems, enabling you to design efficient data models and optimize queries.
  • Comfortable working on Ubuntu as your primary development and deployment environment.
  • Strong analytical and communication skills, coupled with a curiosity for technology.

, Qualifications

,
  • A solid academic foundation in Computer Science, STEM, or a related field.
  • Proven track record in backend development and public-facing API creation.
  • Self-motivated and enterprising, demonstrating both technical and interpersonal skills.
  • Adaptable and inquisitive mindset, eager to learn and grow.

, 'Career Growth Opportunities',
,
, 'We offer generous learning and development allowances, providing you with the resources to enhance your professional skills and advance your career.',
,
, 'Company Culture and Values',
,
, 'Our commitment to diversity in experience, perspective, and background fosters a collaborative and dynamic work environment conducive to innovation and excellence.',
,
, Compensation And Benefits

,
  • Competitive salary with annual compensation reviews.
  • Remote work flexibility, allowing a healthy work-life balance.
  • Recognition and rewards for your contributions.
  • Generous annual leave, along with paid maternity, paternity, and sick leave.
  • Priority Pass for travel, enhancing your global engagement opportunities.

, 'We look forward to your application and the opportunity to explore your potential contributions to our team.',
,
, 'Employment Type: Full-Time\n ']

title: Remote Software Engineer for Stores
description:

,

  • Proficiency in Ubuntu as a development and deployment environment.
  • Solid academic credentials in Computer Science, STEM, or a related discipline.
  • A strong enthusiasm for technology and a proven track record of thriving in diverse, talented teams.

  • A commitment to soft skills, demonstrating passion, thoughtfulness, initiative, and self-motivation.

, Career Growth Opportunities

,
  • Embrace a remote work arrangement with flexible hours.
  • Access opportunities for ongoing learning and professional growth.
  • Benefit from a competitive salary with regular annual compensation reviews.
  • Receive recognition rewards for your valuable contributions.
  • Enjoy generous annual leave, including paid maternity, paternity, and sick leave.
  • Gain a Priority Pass for travel benefits.
  • Experience exposure to international business and cutting-edge technology.

, Company Culture And Values

, 'We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace that welcomes applicants from all backgrounds. We believe that a diversity of experiences, perspectives, and identities contributes to improved work environments and more innovative products. All applicants will receive equitable consideration, regardless of their identity.',
,
, 'Employment Type: Full-Time\n ']

title: Software Engineer Intern
description:
['\n',

Stealth Startup Financial Internship

,

Stealth Startup is a fintech created to help seniors avoid elder fraud and broker fraud. We are looking for a summer intern(remote) to work with our existing CTO/engineer. The intern needs to be experienced with Python, and AWS. Familiarity with banking and investment terms is required.

,

 

,

Job description

,

We are an early stage fintech startup looking for a intern to join our team as an intern. We are seeing amazing interest in our product from prospects. The founding team partners have over 30 years experience in the space.

,

You will work at the direction of the CTO on improvements to our existing product – enhancements, new modules etc. The intern needs to be experienced with Python, and AWS. Familiarity with banking and investment terms is required.

,

We are looking for a commitment of 10-16 hours a week for this role that pays equity, no cash.

,

The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing high-quality applications. They will also be responsible for designing and implementing testable and scalable code.

,

You will be able to participate in sales meetings and meetings with potential investors. This role will give you a great understanding of early stage fintechs.

,

Responsibilities

,
  • Develop quality software and web/mobile applications
  • Design highly scalable, testable code
  • Discover and fix programming bugs
  • Document code
,

Qualifications

,
  • Comfortable working in Python
  • AWS- You will work with Cloud technologies that are part of our standard development and architecture practices
  • Understanding of basic financial investment lingo from banking and investments
  • Database skills
  • Experience reviewing code to find and address potential issues and defects
,

·      Demonstrated ability to problem solve and write quality code

,

·      Demonstrated understanding of computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, etc.)

,

 

,
  • Must speak and write English.
  • Must be able to commit to the equivalent of one to two days a week with scheduled availability. E.g. Will work Monday all day and Tuesday and Wednesday mornings.
  • You should be self-starting with the ability work with minimal supervision.
,

·      Ability to review unfamiliar code, recognize problems, and suggest solutions

,

·      Legally eligible to work in the United States

,

Nice to have:

,

·      Experience launching apps on Apple and Android

,


,

Compensation

,
  • This role will only pay in equity.
,

Interview process. You will have interviews with up to three people and will be a given a coding exercise to walk through with us.

,

Location: Remote. The team works remotely with a US East Coast time frame.

, '\n']

title: Software Engineer (AI/ML) Intern
description:
['\n',

The Role: Software Engineer Intern

,

We’re on the lookout for our first engineer focused on AI/ML at Hangtight. As an early team member in our fast-paced startup, you'll dive into projects that touch on everything from data modeling and algorithm design to integrating machine learning into our core product features. Your insights will be key in shaping how we harness AI/ML to build a word class experience for our users.

,


,

What We’re Looking For

,
  • Tech Skills: Solid experience with at least one of Go/Golang and Dart/Flutter, plus familiarity with cloud computing and serverless frameworks (ideally on Google Cloud with Google Cloud Functions).
  • Hands-On Experience: Previous work on mobile or web applications, and a knack for building scalable, high-quality software.
  • AI/ML Passion: Some background in AI/ML—whether that’s through coursework, projects, or previous internships—is a big plus. We're looking for someone who can contribute to our machine learning models and data-driven decision-making processes.
  • Startup Mindset: We need someone proactive, diligent, and comfortable working with minimal supervision in a startup environment.
  • Team Player: Excellent communication skills and the ability to thrive in a remote, collaborative setting.
,


,

Our Tech Stack

,
  • Languages: Javascript, Python, Go, Dart
  • Frameworks & Infrastructure: Flutter, Google Cloud Functions, Firebase, Google Compute Engine
  • Data Tools: Firestore, FaunaDB
,


,

Compensation

,

This will be based on your scope of work and prior experience.

,


,

To stand out, send a recent project you've built to rich.fortune@hangtight.live

, '\n']

description:

title: Developer, FileMaker Pro (Open to Remote)
description:
['\n The Information Technology department at Penguin Random House (PRH) is looking for a Developer to join their team.\u202f This developer will report to the Manager of Applications. Our developers build products and services that are designed well, developed fast, and provide value.\u202fThe Developer will work with a small development team within PRH in a dynamic, agile development environment.\u202f',
,
, Specific responsibilities include: 

, 'FileMaker Pro Development:',
,
,
  • Develop, test, and maintain custom FileMaker Pro solutions to support our production workflows.
  • Design and implement complex scripts for data import, validation, automation, and workflow optimization.
  • Ensure data integrity and security through robust access control and permissions.
  • Develop and maintain user-friendly interfaces with a focus on usability and accessibility.


, 'Web Development:',
,
,
  • Contribute to the full software development lifecycle, from design and development to deployment and maintenance.
  • Build and maintain web applications using modern technologies such as React/Redux, Node.js, and PHP.
  • Develop and maintain RESTful APIs for data integration and communication between systems.
  • Participate in all aspects of frontend development, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.


, 'Cloud Technologies:',
,
,
  • Assist in the migration and management of applications on cloud platforms such as AWS.
  • Leverage cloud services like S3, Lambda, and Cognito to enhance application performance and scalability.
  • Collaboration & Communication:
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams, including business stakeholders, product managers, and designers.
  • Communicate effectively and professionally, both written and verbal.
  • Proactively identify and resolve technical challenges.


, Please apply if you meet the following qualifications:

,
  • Experience with FileMaker Pro, including proficiency in layout design, scripting, calculations, reporting, and server/Go.
  • Strong knowledge of JavaScript (ES6+), HTML5, CSS3, and one or more programming languages (PHP, Node, Python). Experience with React/Redux or similar frameworks.
  • Strong knowledge of database concepts, ability to write complex SQL queries (MySQL, PostgreSQL), and awareness of OWASP top 10 security threats.
  • Familiarity with designing and implementing RESTful APIs and object-oriented design.
  • Experience with agile methodologies, source code control, and AWS environment (S3, containers, Lambda, Cognito).
  • Excellent communication, problem-solving, decision-making, and multitasking abilities.
  • Knowledge of website accessibility standards.


, The environment you’ll be working in:

,
  • File Maker Pro
  • React/Redux 
  • PHP
  • MySQL, Postgresql
  • WordPress 
  • SCSS Modules 
  • CI/CD pipeline to production w/GitLab CI 
  • Test automation for unit, integration 
  • Docker 
  • Jest and Enzyme unit tests 
  • AWS, Pantheon web hosting  


, The PRH office is located in New York City. The position is open to remote candidates.

, The salary range for this position is $95,000 – 115,000. All positions are currently eligible for annual profit award or bonus, subject to Company results.

, Please apply by February 18th using our online application process and include a resume and cover letter with salary requirements.

, "Penguin Random House job postings include a good faith compensation range for each open position. The salary range listed is specific to each particular open position and takes into account various factors including the specifics of the individual role, and candidate's relevant experience and qualifications.",
,
, 'Full-time employees are eligible for our comprehensive benefits program. Our range of benefits include, but are not limited to, Medical/Prescription drug insurance, Dental, Vision, Health Care/Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, Health Savings Account, Pre-Tax and Roth 401(k), Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance, Life/AD&D Insurance, Commuter Benefits, Student Loan Repayment Program, Educational Assistance & generous paid time off.',
,
, "Penguin Random House is the leading adult and children's publishing house in North America, the United Kingdom and many other regions around the world. In publishing the best books in every genre and subject for all ages, we are committed to quality, excellence in execution, and innovation throughout the entire publishing process: editorial, design, marketing, publicity, sales, production, and distribution. Our vibrant and diverse international community of nearly 300 publishing brands and imprints include Ballantine Bantam Dell, Berkley, Clarkson Potter, Crown, DK, Doubleday, Dutton, Grosset & Dunlap, Little Golden Books, Knopf, Modern Library, Pantheon, Penguin Books, Penguin Press, Penguin Random House Audio, Penguin Young Readers, Portfolio, Puffin, Putnam, Random House, Random House Children's Books, Riverhead, Ten Speed Press, Viking, and Vintage, among others. More information can be found at http://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/.",
,
, 'Penguin Random House values the array of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.',
,
, Company:, ' Penguin Random House LLC',
,
, Country:, ' United States of America',
,
, State/Region:, ' New York',
,
, City: , 'New York',
,
, Postal Code:, ' 10019',
,
, Job ID:, ' 276562',
,
, 'Date: Jan 20, 2025',
,
, 'Location:',
,
, 'New York, NY, US, 10019',
,
, Nearest Major Market: , 'Manhattan',
,
, Nearest Secondary Market: , 'New York City',
,
, Job Segment: , ' Book Publishing, Cloud, Testing, Developer, Web Design, Publishing, Technology, Creative\n ']

title: .NET Web Developer--REMOTE (Wisconsin Resident Only)
description:
['\n',

This role can be 100% remote, but all work must be done from Wisconsin.

,

,

Required Skills

,

Demonstrated expertise with Entity Framework .NET Core (8+ years)

,

Strong experience with Rest APIs (5+ years)

,

Demonstrated extensive hands-on experience with fullstack development (8+ years)

,

Strong familiarity and experience with OAuth and OpenID Connect (8+ years)

,

,

Top 3-4 desired skills required for the position:

,

 Demonstrated expertise with Entity Framework .NET Core

,

 Strong experience with Rest APIs

,

 Demonstrated extensive hands-on experience with fullstack development

,

 Strong familiarity and experience with OAuth and OpenID Connect

,

Will this position have access to FTI (Federal Tax Information)? No

,

On Call hours required? Yes (minimal)

,

Will the position require any weekend coverage? (IE: weekend maintenance) Yes (minimal)

,

Is this position Remote, Hybrid**, or In Person? 90-100% remote but can require staff to

come onsite as necessary with sufficient notice.

,

,

,

This position will help develop new products and support existing web applications that are

,

maintained within the Enterprise section. The candidate will join an existing team to work on a

,

critical API consumed by multiple other development teams. They will have to contend with the

organizational challenges associated with balancing competing priorities from multiple teams.

,

Strong experience with REST APIs, fullstack development, .NET Core, and OAuth and OpenID

,

Connect are necessary for success in this role. Experience with writing custom SQL, coding for

authentication, using LDAP, supporting applications running in IIS, and test-driven development

and automated testing methodology is also helpful. The team uses GitHub for code

management, so familiarity with the tool and its uses is also important. Prior experience with

Security applications development is also valued.

Additionally, this candidate will work on projects as needed that include .NET MVC and .NET

Core web applications. They will use languages and tools such as JavaScript, jQuery, C#,

,

Bootstrap, and Kendo UI. Strong understanding of ASP.NET MVC and .NET Core, as well as

,

WebAPI and n-tier architecture are essential. Experience with SQL Server and developing stored

,

procedures is also helpful.

,

Project duties will include requirements analysis, design, front-end and back-end web

,

application development, testing, deployment activities, and production support. Expectations

,

for this position are development of quality code, active participation in code reviews, sharing

,

expertise, respectful communication, transparency, creation of technical documentation and the

,

ability to perform timely and quality production support. Strong communication skills and

,

collaborative mindset are critical to success in this role.

,

,

All require 8 years of experience unless specified:

,

Analytical and problem-solving skills. Has provided

,

production support to applications post-production

,

Experience with authentication and authorization

,

techniques, including OAuth and OpenID Connect

,

Full stack development experience

,

Requirements analysis

,

Experience with REST APIs and web services 5 years

,

Experience with the full SDLC and knowledge of project

,

management principles

,

Experience writing clear and concise technical

,

documentation and communication, including technical

,

requirements and design 5 years

,

Excellent clear and concise communication skills,

,

written and verbally

,

Experience performing unit and smoke tests

,

Experience with .NET applications and web application

,

design patterns

,

Application development expertise using .NET MVC

,

with C#; .NET Core, JavaScript, JQuery, Bootstrap, C#

,

Familiarity with GitHub and JIRA 5 years

,

Experience with SQL Server Stored Procedures 3 years

,

Experience with Entity framework and Kendo controls

,

(e.g., Telerik, Angular, etc.)

,

Experience using CSS and HTML, and writing JavaScript

,

based responsive HTML 5 applications

,

Techniques for proactively prevent and reactively

,

respond to security threats 5 years

,

Experience with IIS

,

MS SQL Server & SQL Client tools

,

Beacon Hill is an equal opportunity employer and individuals with disabilities and/or protected veterans are encouraged to apply.

,
,

California residents: Qualified applications with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act.

,
,

If you would like to complete our voluntary self-identification form, please click here or copy and paste the following link into an open window in your browser: https://jobs.beaconhillstaffing.com/eeoc/

,
,

Completion of this form is voluntary and will not affect your opportunity for employment, or the terms or conditions of your employment. This form will be used for reporting purposes only and will be kept separate from all other records.

,
,

Company Profile:

Beacon Hill Technologies, a premier National Information Technology Staffing Group, provides world class technology talent across all industries utilizing a complete suite of staffing services. Beacon Hill Technologies' dedicated team of recruiting and staffing experts consistently delivers quality IT professionals to solve our customers' technical and business needs.

Beacon Hill Technologies covers a broad spectrum of IT positions, including Project Management and Business Analysis, Programming/Development, Database, Infrastructure, Quality Assurance, Production/Support and ERP roles.

,
,

Learn more about Beacon Hill and our specialty divisions, Beacon Hill Associates, Beacon Hill Financial, Beacon Hill HR, Beacon Hill Legal, Beacon Hill Life Sciences and Beacon Hill Technologies by visiting www.bhsg.com.

,
,

Benefits Information:

,
,

Beacon Hill offers a robust benefit package including, but not limited to, medical, dental, vision, and federal and state leave programs as required by applicable agency regulations to those that meet eligibility. Upon successfully being hired, details will be provided related to our benefit offerings.

,
,



We look forward to working with you.

Beacon Hill. Employing the Future™

, '\n']

title: Remote Blockchain Engineer - Software
description:
['\n', Job Overview

, 'We are seeking a highly skilled Software Engineer specializing in blockchain technology to join our dynamic team. In this remote role, you will play an integral part in the development of smart contracts for an exciting new initiative, which encompasses both a fungible utility token and a select number of NFTs primarily on the Solana blockchain.',
,
, Company Culture And Values

, 'Our organization is dedicated to fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and inclusivity. We believe in the power of diversity, curiosity, and empathy, which drive our success as we work alongside talented strategists, designers, and engineers. We encourage every team member to actively contribute to our product design and development processes, ensuring that everyone’s voice is heard and valued.',
,
, Key Responsibilities

,
  • Collaborate with a team of engineers to design and develop smart contracts for our new project.
  • Engage in innovative product development utilizing Elixir and LiveView while interfacing with Rust libraries through Rustler.
  • Contribute to defining the overall development roadmap and product strategy.

, Required Skills

,
  • Proficiency in blockchain development, particularly with major platforms such as Solana or Ethereum.
  • Strong understanding of smart contract architecture and deployment.
  • Familiarity with SPL Tokens and Solana smart contracts.
  • Experience with the Rust programming language is highly advantageous.

, Qualifications

,
  • Demonstrable experience in blockchain technology and smart contract development.
  • A background in a collaborative software development environment.

, 'CAREER GROWTH OPPORTUNITIES',
,
, 'This position offers significant potential for professional development as you work on pioneering projects at the convergence of technology and creativity. You will have the opportunity to enhance your skills in blockchain development and build meaningful connections within the industry.',
,
, Compensation And Benefits

,
  • Competitive salary and equity options.
  • Comprehensive health care and benefits package.
  • Unlimited paid time off, which we strongly encourage you to utilize.
  • Generous parental leave policies.
  • Flexible work hours to support work-life balance.
  • Remote working possibilities.
  • Matched 401(k) contributions.

, 'Employment Type: Full-Time\n ']

title: Software Engineer Intern, Video
description:
['\n', About GameChanger

, 'We believe in the life changing impact youth sports have on and off the field. Sports encourage leadership, teamwork, responsibility, and confidence – important life lessons that have the power to propel our youth toward meaningful futures. We recognize that without coaches, parents, and volunteers, organized youth sports could not exist. By building the first and best place to experience the youth sports moments important to our community, we are helping families elevate the next generation through youth sports.',
,
, 'So if you love sports and their community building potential, or building cool products is your sport, GameChanger is the team for you. We are a remote first, dynamic tech company based in New York City, and we are solving some of the biggest challenges in youth sports today.',
,
, 'Kick-start your career at GameChanger! Serving youth sports communities, our app is used to score and live stream millions of games each year. Join us for a 2025 paid internship where you will grow your skills for the road that lies ahead. Our program starts on June 9th and will run for 10 weeks, concluding on August 15th.',
,
, The Position

, "GameChanger's Video team owns our video pipeline end to end, evolves our live streaming and post-game video capabilities for users, simplifies the developer experience for product teams that integrate video into our apps, and ensures we have a scalable and resilient platform to handle millions of streams and hundreds of millions of highlight clips annually. We are looking for a Software Engineer Intern to join us this summer and work on feature development to enhance people's lives.",
,
, What You'll Do

,
  • Learn about video streaming at GC.
  • Collaborate with a team of engineers, designers, testers, and product managers on feature development for our app.
  • Build new features and fix existing ones in the GameChanger app.
  • Learn how to contribute to a CI-driven, scaled engineering organization.
  • Gain experience and mentorship from GC engineers.
  • Work with great people, an awesome product, and lots of fun together along the way!

, Who You Are

,
  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field, or looking to make a career change.
  • Interest and willingness to participate in professional development activities to stay current on industry knowledge.
  • Interest in video streaming and how it works - from content creation to end-user viewing.
  • Big plus if you have experience developing with iOS, Android, or back end development!

, What To Expect

,
  • 10 weeks of experience working on an app that is used by millions of people.
  • $50 per hour pay for your contributions.
  • A trip to NYC for orientation week at GameChanger HQ.
  • MacBooks provided for the duration of the internship by GC.
  • Mentorship from other GC teammates to guide you through the experience.
  • Ability to work remotely throughout the US so you can enjoy your summer from wherever you choose*.
  • Build industry connections with intern peers and GC teammates.

, 'We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.',
,
,
  • DICK’S Sporting Goods has company-wide practices to monitor and protect the company from significant compliance and monetary implications as it pertains to employer state tax liabilities. Due to said guidelines put in place, we are unable to hire in AK, DE, HI, IA, LA, MS, MT, OK, and SC.

, IMPORTANT NOTICE: , 'All official recruitment communications from GameChanger will come from an email address ending in @gc.com and/or no-reply@ashby.hq.com. If you receive communication from any other domain, please be cautious, as it is likely fraudulent.\n ']

title: Remote GIS Developer - Junior Application
description:
['\n', Job Overview

, 'We are in search of a motivated Junior Application GIS Developer to join our remote team. This position is essential for enhancing our innovative GIS solutions and requires an individual who thrives in a collaborative environment. The role may involve occasional after-hours commitment for application upgrades and urgent tasks, reflecting our dedication to excellence and responsiveness in service delivery.',
,
, Key Responsibilities

,
  • Collaborate with team members and customer agencies to efficiently resolve service or incident tickets.
  • Develop scripts and workflows to automate administrative tasks, utilizing your proficiency in Python and other scripting languages.
  • Communicate effectively by preparing and presenting project time and effort estimates, along with creating training materials and documentation for end-users.
  • Manage all phases of development and maintenance for assigned applications and scripts under general supervision.
  • Conduct research on system enhancements and perform thorough analysis and design of computer applications.
  • Design, code, test, and meticulously document applications and scripts, while providing production support for both simple and complex applications.
  • If applicable, mentor junior team members and take the lead on smaller projects or contribute to larger initiatives.

, Required Skills

,
  • Strong written and verbal communication abilities.
  • Outstanding organizational, planning, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
  • A proactive attitude towards learning and adapting to new technologies.

, Qualifications

,
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Geography/GIS, or a related field. Equivalent experience may be considered on a year-for-year basis.
  • Minimum of one year of experience with scripting languages, APIs, and modules including JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Pandas, ArcPy, ArcGIS API, PowerShell, and REST APIs.
  • One year of experience with Microsoft SQL Enterprise Databases (v2016+) and/or PostgreSQL databases.
  • At least two years of scripting experience using Python.
  • Proven capability in developing policies and workflows within collaborative settings, as well as crafting training and documentation for end users.

, Career Growth Opportunities

, 'This role not only provides a platform to enhance your technical skills but also presents opportunities for mentorship and leadership in small to medium projects, promoting long-term professional development within the GIS technology sector.',
,
, Company Culture And Values

, 'Our organization is built on a foundation of collaboration and innovation. We foster an inclusive work environment that values diversity, ensuring every team member feels supported and empowered to contribute their best.',
,
, Networking And Professional Opportunities

, 'Join a network of professionals dedicated to leveraging technology for impactful solutions. The role provides ample opportunities for skill development and professional connections within the GIS community.',
,
, 'Employment Type: Contractor\n ']

title: Application Developer
description:
['\n',

Type of Requisition: Regular

,


,

Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: None

,


,

Public Trust/Other Required: None

,


,

Job Family: Software Development

,


,

Skills:

,


,

Angular,Java,JavaScript

,


,

Experience:

,


,

1 + years of related experience

,


,

Job Description:

,


,

Seize your opportunity to make a personal impact as a Software Developer Associate supporting the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) Center for Program Integrity (CPI) on the Unified Case Management (UCM) system. Here, you’ll tailor cutting-edge solutions to the unique requirements of our clients. GDIT is your place to make meaningful contributions to challenging projects and grow a rewarding career.

,


,

At GDIT, people are our differentiator. As a Software Developer Associate you will help ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. Our work depends on a software developer joining our team to develop front-end web application functionality using Angular, Javascript, CSS, and HTML technologies that enhance the investigative capabilities against fraud, waste, and abuse within CPI.

,


,

HOW YOU WILL MAKE AN IMPACT:

,


,

Work with an interdisciplinary team and will be responsible for coding and unit testing interactive and dynamic user-interface solutions

,


,

Researches, designs, develops, tests, and/or modifies enterprise-wide systems and/or applications

,


,

Assists with all phases of the software development lifecycle

,


,

Assists with analyzing user/business needs and functionality to plan and design software systems to meet those needs

,


,

Assists with creating a variety of models and diagrams that show programmers the software code needed for an application

,


,

Performs software updates, refinement, testing, and debugging

,


,

Prepares reports on software project specifications, activities, or status

,


,

Assists with the documentation of software or system for future maintenance and updates

,


,

WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED:

,


,

Education : Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or Information Systems or related field

,


,

Required Experience : 1+ years of experience

,


,

Required Technical Skills : Experience or knowledge of Angular, Javascript, HTML, CSS, GitHub, Node.js

,


,

Security Clearance Level: None needed, however must have the ability to obtain Public Trust

,


,

Required Skills and Abilities : Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; Problem-solving mindset; Ability to understand and execute against customer business requirements; Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate with customers and internal cross-functional teams; Ability to prioritize and work on multiple projects at the same time; Ability to work independently; Self-motivated, well-organized and strict attention to details

,


,

Preferred Skills : Experience in AWS, Spring Boot, ActiveMQ, Jira, Confluence; Familiarity with large, complex data sources using PostgreSQL or SQL and experience with data migration and/or maintenance activity as associated with the data sources for the application; Agile or SAFe experience; Ability to understand and manage customer expectations and software implementation methodology; Back-end development experience would be a plus; Experience supporting CMS and the Center for Program Integrity

,


,

Location : Remote 100%

,


,

Working Hours : 40 hours per week, available within the core hours of Monday-Friday 9am to 5pm EST

,


,

Residency Requirement: Applicants shall have lived in the United States at least three (3) out of the last five (5) years prior to submitting an application for a Federal ID Card

,


,

GDIT IS YOUR PLACE:

,


,

401K with company match

,


,

Comprehensive health and wellness packages

,


,

Internal mobility team dedicated to helping you own your career

,


,

Professional growth opportunities including paid education and certifications

,


,

Cutting-edge technology you can learn from

,


,

Rest and recharge with paid vacation and holidays

,


,

The likely salary range for this position is $62,962 - $74,750. This is not, however, a guarantee of compensation or salary. Rather, salary will be set based on experience, geographic location and possibly contractual requirements and could fall outside of this range.

,


,

Our benefits package for all US-based employees includes a variety of medical plan options, some with Health Savings Accounts, dental plan options, a vision plan, and a 401(k) plan offering the ability to contribute both pre and post-tax dollars up to the IRS annual limits and receive a company match. To encourage work/life balance, GDIT offers employees full flex work weeks where possible and a variety of paid time off plans, including vacation, sick and personal time, holidays, paid parental, military, bereavement and jury duty leave. GDIT typically provides new employees with 15 days of paid leave per calendar year to be used for vacations, personal business, and illness and an additional 10 paid holidays per year. Paid leave and paid holidays are prorated based on the employee’s date of hire. The GDIT Paid Family Leave program provides a total of up to 160 hours of paid leave in a rolling 12 month period for eligible employees. To ensure our employees are able to protect their income, other offerings such as short and long-term disability benefits, life, accidental death and dismemberment, personal accident, critical illness and business travel and accident insurance are provided or available. We regularly review our Total Rewards package to ensure our offerings are competitive and reflect what our employees have told us they value most.

,


,

We are GDIT. A global technology and professional services company that delivers consulting, technology and mission services to every major agency across the U.S. government, defense and intelligence community. Our 30,000 experts extract the power of technology to create immediate value and deliver solutions at the edge of innovation. We operate across 30 countries worldwide, offering leading capabilities in digital modernization, AI/ML, Cloud, Cyber and application development. Together with our clients, we strive to create a safer, smarter world by harnessing the power of deep expertise and advanced technology.

,


,

We connect people with the most impactful client missions, creating an unparalleled work experience that allows them to see their impact every day. We create opportunities for our people to lead and learn simultaneously. From securing our nation’s most sensitive systems, to enabling digital transformation and cloud adoption, our people are the ones who make change real.

,


,

GDIT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

, '\n']

title: WalkMe Developer
description:
['\n', Responsibilities

, "Kforce has a client that is seeking a WalkMe Developer in Draper, UT. Summary: The Digital solution builder will work with company's teammates to design and build digital solutions on our client facing portals. In this role, you will analyze interaction data, map processes and design solutions that will drive engagement, self-help and satisfaction, as part of our effort to Commit to Quality. Digital solutions are built using the WalkMe Digital Adoption Platform. Responsibilities:",
,
,
  • Support requirements gathering and documentation to map business processes to be built out as WalkMe content
  • Build and test WalkMe solutions
  • Create documentation, tracking and baselines to measure solution performance
  • Ensure that the WalkMe solution addresses the goals and needs

, Requirements

,
  • 1+ years of experience building WalkMe solutions and/or WalkMe certifications
  • Experience in analyzing and mapping business processes or functional requirements
  • Experience with other Digital Adoption tools
  • Understanding of instructional design
  • Existing or transferable skills in WalkMe, Digital Adoption, application development, web development, or business process mapping
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Excellent skills in MS Office applications including Visio, Word, and PowerPoint
  • Basic jQuery skills
  • Basic CSS and HTML skills

, 'The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.',
,
, 'We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.',
,
, "Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.",
,
, 'This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.',
,
, 'Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.',
,
, 'By clicking “Apply Today” you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages or emails from Kforce and its affiliates, and service providers. Note that if you choose to communicate with Kforce via text messaging the frequency may vary, and message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You will always have the right to cease communicating via text by using key words such as STOP.\n ']

title: Software Engineer II
description:
['\n', Position: , 'Software Engineer II',
,
, Department:, ' Innovation',
,
, Reports to, ': Software Engineer II',
,
, Location: , ' Full-time / Work from home',
,
, Compensation, ': $90,000 - $110,000',
,
, Open through: , ' February 24, 2025',
,
, 'Tessitura is a non-profit company dedicated to helping arts and cultural organizations thrive.',
,
, 'CRM lies at the heart of our mission and our technology platform. With Tessitura in their toolkit, organizations can achieve their goals with ease.',
,
, 'The Tessitura community includes over 800 cultural institutions in ten countries. Our staff provide 24/7 support and offer guidance to grow revenue and build lifelong engagement.',
,
, Job Summary:

, "At Tessitura, the Innovation Group's mission is to build Tessitura's product and technology innovation pipeline from identification of need, through ideation, product development, engineering, infrastructure, quality assurance, deployment, and feedback/iteration cycles, ensuring that we deliver continually innovated technology to our members, ecosystem partners, and team members.",
,
, 'The Engineering division is responsible for creating enterprise systems that cut across all the functions of an arts and cultural organization to enable connections with prospects, donors, members, single-ticket buyers, and subscribers and other constituent groups. Tessitura offers an equally strong solution for ticketing, fundraising, marketing, customer relationship management, data segmentation and web capabilities. This includes business facing applications, consumer facing web application, Android-based access control systems, and more.',
,
, Software Engineer IIs, ' at Tessitura are highly collaborative and bring creativity and curiosity to their work every day. They bring some Software Engineering experience to the team and are actively growing their knowledge and engineering leadership skills as they prepare to be senior software engineering leaders on the team. They exhibit a natural predilection to learning, self-improvement, and elevated team operations as they build our industry leading software solutions.',
,
, 'We build and support diverse products such as a business facing CRM, ticketing and contribution management solution, a consumer-facing, a white label e-commerce application, and an Android-based access control application.',
,
, 'We serve a thriving, unique, and passionate global community of Arts and Cultural organizations. As such, successful Software Engineers at Tessitura Network math the passion and creativity of the members we serve.',
,
, Specific Responsibilities:

,
  • Program functional software systems as described by the Product group.
  • Ensure all committed code has unit tests, and that the build is successful prior to committing work.
  • Support Innovation Group and Tessitura Network short and long-term objectives by building software that achieves those objectives.
  • Participate in team design, culture, and planning conversations.
  • Participate in conversations with stakeholders.
  • Learn and understand domain knowledge related to our software and the Arts and Culture industry.
  • Improve the performance, maintenance, deployability, and test coverage within their assigned projects.
  • Support the Tessitura platform, triage problems and troubleshoot technical issues.
  • Stay appraised of modern and emerging software engineering technology.
  • Adhere to the Tessitura Engineering Foundations.

, General Responsibilities:

,
  • To support the Innovation Group on key short and long-term strategic planning issues and make recommendations on important decisions.
  • To integrate as a key member of the Software Engineering team, advancing the business of arts and culture.
  • To role model, embed and reinforce the connection between the Company's values, people, and organizational performance, taking personal accountability for individual, departmental and organizational performance.
  • Support and take personal responsibility for driving Tessitura's company culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, transparency, and openness, and to have mutual respect, and appreciation for everyone's contribution to the Company, offering support and encouragement to others as required.
  • To maintain and improve the Company's reputation as a leading service provider with a focus on Member needs, working as a leader, taking a broad, strategic, cross Company view in any decisions.
  • To understand the risks and challenges that faces the Company as an international organization, taking account of Age, Disability, Gender, Language, Race, Religious Belief, and Sexual Orientation.
  • To support and take personal responsibility for driving the Company's Corporate Plan, and associated strategies, and to have mutual respect, and appreciation for everyone's contribution to the Company, offering support and encouragement to others as required.
  • As a term of employment, the post holder may be required to undertake such other duties and / or times of work as may be reasonably be required commensurate with the general level of responsibility within the Company.

, Required Skills and Experience:

,
  • 2+ years of programming experience with at least one modern object-oriented language such as C#, Ruby, PHP, or Java
  • 2+ years of experience in JavaScript frameworks such as Angular or React
  • Experience working with a source control system in a shared code environment
  • An open, curious, and growth-oriented mindset

, Preferred Skills and Experience:

,
  • 2+ years with experience programming C# applications
  • Software bootcamp certification, BA/BS in Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or related field or equivalent experience
  • Cloud computing experience managing and deploying cloud infrastructure as code and working with serverless computing and cloud services to build applications
  • Experience working in a team, shared code responsibility software development environment
  • Experience working in a distributed office environment

, 'Our company is committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills, as well as providing a workplace of mutual respect, free of any discrimination or harassment. We seek to recruit, develop, and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.',
,
, Benefits And Compensation

, "The compensation reflects a U.S. salary range based on current market data. The candidate's skills, experience, and other relevant factors will determine the final compensation.",
,
, "Tessitura Network offers a comprehensive and robust benefits package designed to support our employees' well-being. Our offerings include various medical, dental, and vision plans, as well as life and AD&D insurance, disability insurance, employee assistance programs, and a 401(k) retirement plan with employer match. We prioritize work-life balance by providing generous paid time off, including vacation and sick leave, 12 weeks of paid parental leave, a 7-week sabbatical after seven years of service, and a recharge week between Christmas and New Year’s. These benefits are available to our fully remote team, with adjustments made as required by local laws.",
,
, Diversity, Equity, Accessibility, and Inclusion (DEAI) Commitment

, 'At Tessitura, our mission is to enable arts and cultural organizations to achieve their goals. We recognize that having a diverse team is not only critical to our commitment to adopt equitable behaviors, but it will also fuel collaboration, innovation and creativity as we deliver on our mission.',
,
, 'Creating an environment where everyone feels safe and comfortable in bringing their authentic selves to work is both our pledge and our passion.',
,
, 'Ultimately, providing an accessible and inclusive workplace will allow the Tessitura community to thrive.',
